title: Selangor sultan warns non-Muslims against interfering in Islamic matters
text:
Sultan Sharafuddin Idris Shah wants non-Muslims to emulate Muslims by not interfering in the religious affairs of other faiths. (Bernama pic)
PETALING JAYA: Selangorâ€™s Sultan Sharafuddin Idris Shah has reminded non-Muslims to respect and refrain from interfering in matters relating to Islamic affairs.
Sultan Sharafuddin was responding to a proposal by Beruas MP Ngeh Koo Ham to include non-Muslim constitutional experts in a committee studying the conflicts between shariah laws and the Federal Constitution.
â€œHis Majesty hopes that politicians, especially non-Muslims, refrain from continuously interfering in Islamic matters.
â€œInstead, non-Muslims should emulate Muslims, who do not interfere in the religious affairs of other faiths in Malaysia,â€ the ruler said in a post on the Selangor Royal Officeâ€™s Facebook page today.
The ruler then cited verse six of Surah al-Kafirun of the Quran, which states: â€œFor you is your religion, and for me is my religion.â€
Sultan Sharafuddin said he also took note of DAP secretary-general Loke Siew Fookâ€™s statement on the matter.
Earlier today, Loke sought to downplay the controversy stemming from Ngehâ€™s proposal.
He said the party was not trying to interfere in Islamic affairs, and also clarified Ngehâ€™s comments on the authority behind the setting up of the committee, while saying that any recommendations which involve amendments to the law must be brought to the Cabinet.
He said non-Muslims need not be concerned about the composition of the committee as any legal amendment involving the rights of non-Muslims must be scrutinised and decided by the Cabinet before following the â€œusual parliamentary processâ€.

author: antaranews.com
title: Good Friday offers lessons on love, sacrifice: Pandjaitan - ANTARA News
text: "In this Good Friday commemoration, we learn about love and sacrifice," he said in a post on his official Instagram account here on Friday. According to the minister, the teaching of love has helped develop brotherhood between Indonesian citizens regardless of differences in ethnicity, race, religion, and group. "I want to quote God's word that 'As I have loved you, so you also must love one another,'" he said. He invited the diverse community in the country to coexist peacefully to support greater national development in the future. Furthermore, Pandjaitan said that Easter Day is a reminder of faith and hope for people. "God never forsakes His people. So, on this occasion, let us unite in prayer, reflect on His great sacrifice for the salvation of mankind," he added. He then invited people to reflect on and follow those values in daily life and decisions, both in their social and personal lives. "I, Luhut Binsar Pandjaitan, and my family wish you a happy commemoration of the three holy days, which are Maundy Thursday, Good Friday, and Easter Day, for Christians throughout Indonesia," he said. On Friday, as many as 500 congregants participated in the "Way of the Cross" at the Jakarta Cathedral. Public relation staff of the Jakarta Archdiocese and the Jakarta Cathedral, Susyana Suwadie, said that the Cathedral Church held the Good Friday service, which included a devotional procession about the story of Christ's death.
